details: Designed the C4 architecture and detailed specifications for the 'Decant' system integration.
Analyzed requirements for migrating the Fulfilment Platform System (FPS) to an Active-Active architecture.
Defined integration contracts between legacy FPS systems and new automation hardware.
Authored 21 technical design documents and decision records (ADRs).
Served as an initial engineer for the MFC initiative, defining technical requirements for vendor onboarding.
Conducted 'Build vs. Buy' analysis for the Warehouse Management System (WMS).
Designed WMS/WCS integration patterns to meet system latency requirements.
Authored 11 technical design documents and decision records (ADRs).
Implemented 'Tray Identifier' logic to improve physical inventory tracking.
Redesigned the task buffer management system to deterministic logic, improving task availability.
Optimized middleware orchestration to reduce API latency for in-store operations.
Authored 6 technical design documents and decision records (ADRs).
Built the 'fps-cfc-adaptor' to integrate internal fulfilment workflows with automated marshalling hardware.
Implemented state machine logic to handle out-of-order events from vendor systems.
Updated the DLQ Processor with replay capabilities to handle integration failures.
Authored 9 technical design documents and decision records (ADRs).
Built 'PickAdmin' using the Kubernetes Java SDK to manage dynamic CronJobs.
Developed the 'Task and Timer' service to handle time-sensitive business signals.
Delivered the 'Pre-Pick' feature to support increased load during peak periods.
Integrated the 'Crystal' algorithm (G3) for tray/trolley generation, enabling asynchronous task processing.
Implemented buffering for long-running jobs to maintain system responsiveness.
Led the technical migration from legacy trolley algorithms to multi-variable generation logic.

2019.summary: Fulfilment Platform System (FPS) & Logistic Unit Service
details: Designed the 'Logistic Unit Service' as a core microservice for the new FPS platform.
Implemented 'PureGroup' logic to support inventory management in a distributed system.
Applied domain-driven design (DDD) to support scalable fulfilment operations.
Developed 'Delivery Service' and 'PickTrip Service' to support new handheld devices.
Built the 'WMS Collaborator' to integrate automated stock retrieval systems.
Contributed to the migration from legacy .NET monoliths to distributed Java microservices.
Decoupled the 'Picking Component' from the legacy DMS monolith to allow independent scaling.
Implemented a 'Rules Engine' for trip generation and pre-creation logic to manage load spikes.
Delivered Start-of-Day (SOD) optimization logic for daily route generation.
Integrated the 'Topaz' Simulated Annealing algorithm for route planning.
Developed re-routing logic to handle real-time aisle obstructions.
Implemented gamification features to improve user engagement.
Implemented 'On-Demand Picktrip Generation' evaluating multiple constraints (Weight, Volume).
Designed the 'PickTrip Buffer Management' system to throttle workflow load.
Optimized the generation engine to support scaling order volumes.
Implemented 1-D Path Improvement logic using fixture sequencing.
Developed 'Aisle Flipping' algorithms to reduce picker travel time.
Established initial data-driven optimization patterns for the legacy system.
Transitioned from Infosys to Tesco as a Senior Software Engineer, focusing on legacy .NET modernization.
Promoted to Senior Software Engineer. Delivered critical signage solutions for Target retail stores.
Promoted to Software Engineer. Delivered web-based procurement systems for Rite.Net.
Joined Infosys as a Trainee. Worked on HR domain applications for Hudson.
